sentences.english: He was a cunt for the shrugging.
sentences.chinese: 就耸肩来说，他就是一个王八蛋。

sentences.english: I didn't say anything. I shrugged my shoulders.
They blush, avert their eyes, hunch their shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她们会脸红，躲避目光，耸耸肩。

sentences.english: Woman alarm hunch, put forward to want 1 million dollar to demons and monsters then.
sentences.chinese: 妇女耸了耸肩，于是向魔怪提出要100万美元。

sentences.english: He shrug his low opinion of the occupant of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他耸耸肩表示对那房间的住户不屑一顾。

sentences.english: Classic one-sided shrug. Translation: I’ve absolutely no confidence of what I just said.
sentences.chinese: 单边耸肩的动作表示对自己刚才说的话极不自信。

sentences.english: She turned to her companion who shrugged.
sentences.chinese: 她转向她的同伴，他耸耸肩。

sentences.english: "Each to his own, " she said with a shrug, and turned away.
sentences.chinese: “人各有志，”她边说边耸耸肩，然后转过头去。

sentences.english: When someone asks me this I just shrug and smile.
sentences.chinese: 当有人问我这个问题时，我就是耸耸肩，笑下。

sentences.english: I mouthed "Mom" and shrugged my shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 我作出“妈妈”的口型，耸耸肩。

sentences.english: People with slumped shoulders and lethargic movements display a lack of self confidence.
sentences.chinese: 一个人耸肩及下滑的动作表现出这个人缺乏自信。

sentences.english: He shrugged and took a pen out of his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他耸耸肩，只得从口袋里面掏出一只笔来。

sentences.english: Why do we use the phrase "cold shoulder" to describe someone rejecting us?
sentences.chinese: 又为什么用“冷漠的耸了耸肩”来表示拒绝别人？

sentences.english: He spread out his arms and shrugged his shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他无可奈何地摊开双臂耸了耸肩。

sentences.english: 'She had some fine lines around her lips,' he shrugs.
sentences.chinese: “她嘴唇周围有一些细线，”他耸了耸肩。

definition: to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to throw/to cast/left-slanting downward brush stroke (calligraphy)
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to pout (to express anger or displeasure)
to wave the hand (to say goodbye, or in a negative gesture)/crank handle
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
